definition: to eat/to consume/to eat at (a cafeteria etc)/to eradicate/to destroy/to absorb/to suffer/to stammer (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [ji2])
not to be trifled with/to be reckoned with

sentences.english: They said being vegetarian wasunscientific, " she said.
sentences.chinese: 他们说吃素是不科学的，”她说。

sentences.english: Which was slightly reminiscent of a friend of mine who is vegetarian except for bacon, but nonetheless . . .
sentences.chinese: 这有点像我一个吃素的朋友只吃腌肉。

sentences.english: When the fox preaches, take care of your geese.
sentences.chinese: 狐狸说它吃素的时候，母鸡就得注意。

sentences.english: Apparently—for the sake of convenience—Haji, the manservant, had also adopted his master's diet.
sentences.chinese: 显然，他的男仆哈吉，为了方便，也随主人吃素了。

sentences.english: I definitely didn’t until I started eating vegan.
sentences.chinese: 我肯定也没有直到我开始吃素。

sentences.english: But how does one equate vegetarianism with the notion of earth-friendliness?
sentences.chinese: 不过这吃素与爱地球的关联性从何说起？

sentences.english: I think vegans and vegetarians are nearly as smug as meat eaters.
sentences.chinese: 不过我还是觉得吃素和吃肉应该是一样高兴得事。

sentences.english: And my family is all the healthier for it.
sentences.chinese: 我们全家人也因为吃素而更健康。

sentences.english: The prevalence of Vitamin B12 deficiency is higher in vegans than in omnivores.
sentences.chinese: 纯素食者的B12缺失发生率比不吃素的人高。

sentences.english: They are mostly vegetarian, although they eat fish and chicken irregularly.
sentences.chinese: 他们大都吃素，但偶尔也吃鱼和鸡。

definition: veganism, a diet consisting solely of plant products/strict vegetarianism
a vegan/person following a vegan diet
dishes with generous amounts of meat and fish/lavish meal
to violate a religious precept/to smoke or drink after giving up
